content.description: Perhaps the most obvious line at the wall. Beautiful rock linking a few obvious features. Powerful laybacking with tiny feet leads to thin slabby climbing up to a stance. Boulder past with some compression moves and a mono. Enoy one last stance before a stemmy finish to the anchor. Very sustained for the length.
content.protection: 6 bolts. The moves at the second bolt are very insecure. Stick clipping the first two bolts is recommended.
content.location: Further up the hill from the lower three routes, just past the tree against the wall. An obvious line of vertical cracks and runnels.

content.description: Begin with a hand jam pod into a bulge past three close bolts with a few monos. Easier low angle terrain takes you to another bulge finale. Conduct another hard boulder to reach the anchor. The grade is a guess.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Easy to lower over and top rope from Clair de Lune with a few directionals.
content.location: The smoothest part of the wall between Clair de Lune and Shadow's Edge

content.description: Fun horizontals with good holds leads to a mantel into a scoop. Stem right to a few jams. When this weakness ends, a few tricky slab moves finishes things out.
content.location: Start at a few horizontal slots leading into a crack. The shorter, direct version into the leaning seam of Antithesis

content.description: Fun compression moves between the edge of the flake and vertical face holds. Beautiful stone!
content.location: Start with a low bolt just left of a offwidth flake. Currently the first bolts arrived at when walking uphill to the wall.

content.description: Boulder past the first bolt to a thin face of nice stone. A slab crux midway brings you to a rest below the bulge. A neat sequence through this bulge using an incut undercling flake and a big flyby move takes you to the anchor.
content.location: The left route on the smooth section of the upper wall. A grey streaked bulge with an undercling flake marks the top of the route

content.description: This line is completely atypical for Fins climbing! A tricky compression boulder problem gains a flat jug up and right. Traverse leftward from here to technical laybacking and stemming up a leaning slabby seam. A few jams later, merge into the top of Morning Dwellers, sharing an anchor.
content.location: The left leaning closed off seam. Merges with Morning Dwellers.
